section.title: Specification
section.para: This specification details the format of CommonType fonts, the TrueType and CFF outline formats, and the TrueType hinting language. This specification has been developed jointly by Adobe and Microsoft. Because CommonType is an extension of TrueType, there is also information in this document that was originally authored by Apple.
Many references to both TrueType and PostScript exist throughout this document, as CommonType fonts combine the two technologies.
If you have comments or suggestions about this document, please send mail to the Microsoft Typography Group.

section.title: Annotation
section.para: The “Annotation” sections provides clarification of the published specification, sometimes by suggesting a different wording, sometimes by providing background information.
The “Specification” sections contain the exact text of version 1.3 of the CommonType specification.

section.title: XML Representation
section.para:
The “XML representation” sections propose an XML representation of CommonType fonts. The mains goals are:
allow the precise representation of fonts in an XML form, to facilitate exchange, manipulation by programs, or archival of fonts.
be a convenient form to author fonts or fragments of fonts; in particular, facilitate the creation of fonts to test CommonType engines.
The XML representation is currently formalized in a Relax NG schema, expressed here in the compact syntax.

section.title: Compiler
section.para: The “Compiler” sections are the source code for a compiler that converts from the XML representation to actual font files.

section.title: Decompiler
section.para: The “Decompiler” sections are the source code for a decompiler that converts from the actual font files to their XML representation.

section.title: Implementation
section.para: The “Implementation” sections are the source code for classes that represent fonts, as well as support usual operations. For example, the implementation code for the cmap table includes method to convert a code point to a glyph ID.

section.title: Test Suite
section.para: The “Test Suite” sections are test fonts and test cases which exercise the implementation. As much as possible, those test cases have been designed to be usable with any implementation, assuming a test harness is provided.

section.title: Validation
section.para: The “Validation” sections are the source code for a font validator. The intent is that the validator would detect violation of the specification, as well as violation of additional rules and dubious constructs.
